intro: Pedicularis sceptrum-carolinum var. glabra, commonly known as the naked monkeyflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink to red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The variety glabra is distinguished by its smooth, hairless stems compared to other varieties in the species.
